description: Persistent identifier schemes supported by ECL/Astro Repo JSON Schema 2.0

data.name: Digital Object Identifier
data.description: Digital Object Identifier; a character string used to uniquely identify an object. A DOI name is divided into two parts, a prefix and a suffix, separated by a slash.

data.name: Bibliographic code
data.description: Astrophysics Data System bibliographic codes; a standardized 19 character identifier according to the syntax yyyyjjjjjvvvvmppppa.

data.name: Oceanographic Cruise DOI
data.description: DOI for research cruise, registered by R2R, IFREMER, etc..

data.name: Source Code DOI
data.description: DOI for software source code, usually registered through the Zenodo repository.

data.name: Research Organization Registry ID
data.description: Unique identifiers for every research organization in the world maintained by Research Organization Registry.

data.name: International Global Sample Number
data.description: International Geo Sample Number; a 9-digit alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies samples from our natural environment and related sampling features.

data.name: Smithsonian Volcano Number
data.description: Unique identifier for volcanoes documented in the Volcanoes of the World (VOTW) database maintained by GVP.

data.name: Mission ID
data.description: U.S. missions with science goals to study planets, moons, asteroids and comets beyond Earth orbit.

data.name: Appolo Sample Generic Number
data.description: Five-digit number for each sample returned by Apollo missions.
